title: Can't send transaction to a contract with already-encoded hex data
body:
I have compiled and deployed a contract.
Now I can call its functions by entering each argument (and the value i.e. amount, if any):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13969584/163733134-12ed47c9-9656-4d56-9fab-d3f436adcd46.png)

But suppose I have the already-encoded, already-packed hex data that calls a given function with given values for its arguments, e.g.
```

```
 I want to send a transaction with those raw data to the contract, and with a certain amount of ETH.

So, I would assume that's what the "Low level interaction" bit at the bottom is for.
I enter the ETH amount at the top:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13969584/163733299-2245a2fb-3141-4bf2-81f5-46343178a2ce.png)

and then I enter the hex data in "Call data" at the bottom and click "Transact":
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13969584/163733250-0c760eeb-2194-4a47-87eb-f4885c641259.png)

However, I get this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13969584/163733335-6633e1cb-3697-44c2-a5c3-97a81df26ec9.png)

But that makes no sense because the "transfer" or "fallback" functions are supposedly for sending transactions **with ETH and no data**, but I am trying to send a transaction **_with_** data.
